text: Milena Jelinek (Czech: Milena Jelínková, née Tobolová) (1935 – April 16, 2020) was a Czech-American screenwriter, playwright and teacher. She wrote the screenplay for the movie Forgotten Light, which was awarded three Czech Lions in 1997. She was an important person during the Czech New Wave. She was married to the late Frederick Jelinek. Jelinek was born in Prague. Jelinek died on April 16, 2020 of COVID-19 in New York City, aged 84. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American playwrights Category:Educators from New York City Category:Writers from Prague Category:Screenwriters from New York City
title: Milena Jelinek
